messages: 6fa52313776443287b360e0efeb37864 (09:03): Is there a way to read mouse position on top of canvas? And I mean read. The mousemove-event won't do, because I need to read it more often than it fires
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (09:08): unfortunately I believe mouse events are the only way how mouse is currently being exposed in the browsers
6fa52313776443287b360e0efeb37864 (09:24): maybe we'll have to just live with it.
976c3ffadc0468d18d4aca16e4353cac (09:27): wow IE9 mobile has crazy good canvas support http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PfYeoR3Ug4E
532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46 (09:36): Can you have daemons running on the client if you change web pages?
86123bebfedc05009c27d1ac8f8c7411 (09:40): 532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46: daemons running?
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (09:42): 532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46: chrome got somethin called background page
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (09:42): 532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46: but nothing in the standard
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (09:42): 6fa52313776443287b360e0efeb37864: you can always use Flash :)
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (09:43): 6fa52313776443287b360e0efeb37864: why do you need more mousemove events ?
532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46 (09:44): jetienne ok. thanks
6fa52313776443287b360e0efeb37864 (09:44): 1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555:  doing a drawing application. I'd like to draw smoother lines.
532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46 (09:49): jetienne: how about revisting a page, then uploading the data because the server is now 'ready'?
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (09:53): 532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46: i dont understand. can you elaborate
532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46 (09:59): jetienne: i'd like to store data in the web browser(minus clear cache) and upload when the server is ready, or when I visit the site again.
532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46 (09:59): believe this is a html5 thingie
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (09:59): 532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46: put them in localStorage
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (10:00): 532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46: this is place to store data between page load
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (10:00): 532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46: upload the content when the site is visited again.
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (10:00): just realized who you were 1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555
532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46 (10:00): jetienne: ok thanks
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (10:01): http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/offline/storage/ 532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46 may be of interest
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (10:01): twitter follower plus I use your QR jquery plugin on my resume site
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (10:03): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: cool:) btw jquery-qrcode got updated recently. one can display on <table> and generate qrcode for string 4000+ char now
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (10:04): not sure i need 4000 characters, but i do use it to link to a vcf file and the root domain so people can easily get the site loaded on their phone
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (10:07): some people put lots of data in qrcode. not sure why. personnaly i put only super simple url in it :)
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (10:07): well, with Nanowrimo coming up...
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (10:07): that would prove an interesting way to present your story
532bf96cc576a5cac8cf5c2c4d4f0a46 (10:10): jetienne: thanks

136126c730b6b812c7c4e0268d186e6a (10:16): f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 maybe I should use Book and nest Offer and forget about Product?
105bbb3c1ce4cdd44a2521c19ab5f155 (10:39): Why are the <div class="caption"> elements on this page all of slightly different width, and how can I make then all vertically aligned (conceptually)?
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (10:40): Hello there.
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (10:42): I'm looking for a free SSL certificate that I can use. Anyone here used startssl ? (http://startssl.com/)
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:01): ireland must be a sad land to be a web developer
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:01): a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6: you can use self-signed certificates for free
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:03): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: Without using a certificate provider ?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:03): a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6: yes
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:03): you get this ugly red warning message when going to the site for the first time
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:04): but you can create certs yourself
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:04): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: Yes well I'm not looking for that big red screen. :)
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:04): a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6: then I suggest you need to get some pennies together :(
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:04): I think cheapest certificates I have seen where 60 USD / year
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:04): Well I see that SSL cert in that link is free.
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:05): Though I'm a little unsure whether I should give my personal details or not. I want to remain as anonymous as possible.
1c32edf178a66ce91df1ac82ee8dd555 (11:05): 60usd/year for less than second of cpu, and 1k of storage
bcbef6628a45535849b6066c357a17ea (11:06): anonymity is important, my friend pays for anonymous domain registration for his eponymous site
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:06): a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6: SSL is also to check your identity
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:06): how there can be trust if I don't know who you are?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:07): would not wonder if any free SSL provider will end up to a blacklist in any point of time
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:07): Well I'm only looking into SSL for connection encryption, as in the technical part.
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:07): To prevent eavesdropping.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:08): a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6: then self-signed is as good as any
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:08): Ok then. 32 768 bit RSA key, here I come.
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:09): jokes, obviously.
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:11): I wonder how they will secure SSL in the future when quantum computers will crack them
9269856f1ac58f20596dc0d1a7498983 (11:11): with quantum encryption
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:13): Hmm I wonder if the one they are selling can break anything?
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:16): The 128 cubit proccessor
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:17): Is there no way to make a valid self-signed SSL cert ? As in not have that giant red screen tear away at my retina ?
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:18): Doesn't mozzila have to add the cert
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:18): Like when those fake cert where removed
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:21): I think you have to buy one that browsers say are valid

a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:21): This browser policy is stupid if you ask me. There's no big red screen when you submit sensitive data via classic no SSL HTTP yet you do get one when using a self-signed SSL cert. It's like they are completely ignoring the issue of encryption.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:21): a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6: it is
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:21): SSL handles both trust and encryption
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:21): there is no model for encryption only
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:21): Unfortunately... :/
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:22): Its safer this way
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:22): it is
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:22): because otherwise DNS spoofing would enable man-in-the-middle attacks
a9cca614ecc1e67f985123ba13a4aaa6 (11:22): Just looks like another marketing strategy to rip off cash from the users. VeriSign comes into mind.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:22): giving SSL cert is not enough because without verification chain you cannot know if it's real thing
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (11:23): that's why losing those google.com etc. certs was a big deal
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:23): Look at that company that got hacked
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:24): And hackers made certs and with this they listens in on Iran's Gmail accounts 300000 of them
e664ec4608ec3f408acc9b0428163765 (11:25): So browsers right away removed them
